performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: I love the Branford solo, very sweet and where Jerry’s solo is supposed to be they transition to “Its Takes a Lot to Laugh…” Give it a listen.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Great version at Alpine
Notable for double-time in the back half of the tune...kinda funny
A beast version here.  People get your Dick (6) out.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Surprised to not see this killer version on here. Bobbys totally into it while Jerry shreds. Check it out
Overall great show here.  Powerful and long CC Rider.  Get your road trips out.
The build the final jam and its just waterfalls all over you.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Awesome guitar work by the boys.....
Ususally not a fan of this song, but this version is quite amazing, This night was something special indeed!!
Out of an amazing Gloria jam, the first C. C. Rider is a must listen, Bobby just spits out the lyrics.  The jam that follows is hot as well.
Killer grove to this one.
Smoking version
this one is nice clocks in at 9:01 with lot's of jamming

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Passionate reading of an often underrated song.
A hot Scarlet->Fire->C. C. Rider.

performances.venue: West Palm Beach Auditorium West Palm Beach, FL
performances.description: This is when I thought the show locked in.
Real fiery sequence of China Cat->Rider->C.C. Rider. Brent and Jerry are on Fire here a real standout

performances.venue: Golden Hall, Community Concourse San Diego, CA
performances.description: underrated gem of a song hot performance, spicy Bobby
Shoooooooot, had no idea how awesome this song was. Glad I gave it a chance!
Rarely a song I like, but this one stands out to me, probably because of Brent and Jerry, in that order
This Rider blew the roof off Dane Co Coliseum on a snowy night
Shocking a version of C.C. Rider could be this hot, a pinnace of the song. Fantastic.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY

performances.description: Right on the heels of Jack Straw>Franklin's Tower, keeps the momentum going in great first set
Brent & Bobby WOW!
Aggressive yet patient and focused.
Not usually one of my favorite tunes, but this versions kicks ass
Best I've ever heard.
Spencer Dryden on Guitar, Sounds more like the Airplane than the Grateful Dead, give it a listen, nice change from standard dead version
The best bobby slide solo I've ever heard into a pretty good Harmonica Solo! Great version
A strong version.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Bobby's vocals are killer.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Great swing to this version. Excellent Brent and Jerry solos. A gem of a show from an odd tour.
Passionate vocals from Weir with smooth playing all around
Hot vocals. Bruce crazy good. Jerry & Vince sound good on their solos. Awesome version.
Truly beautiful blues. Segues perfect into Train to Cry…

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Always a favorite some sweet jamming all round

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Amazing interplay, hard rockin', Awesome Brent vocals during his solo
Really cool 2nd set CC Rider.  Gritty and bluesy.  Garcia plays some unique chords at the end

performances.venue: Blossom Music Center Cuyahoga Falls, OH
performances.description: Swampy, dirty heat lightning vibe...Jerry and Bobby just tearing it up in every way possible. This show is melting my face
A hot version to open the second set.
Oh yeah this is a nice swayin’ version. Nice and slow with Brent’s woozy organ and funk picking from Jer. Bobby doesn’t miss a word.
A standout version from a great show.
Bobby gets the juices flowing
Beefy C.C. Rider, Brent laying on the hammond, a listenable slide solo by Bobby, all tied together with some Phil Bombs
More insane back and forth between Bobby and Jerry and Brent.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA
performances.description: Hot solos from Jerry and Brent. Killer blues.

performances.venue: San Diego Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: china>rider>cc rider

performances.venue: Cole Field House College Park, MD
performances.description: real nice, everyone's parts on this are great
The boys were feeling the blues on this evening.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Crisp and on target excellent Bobby vocals.
Some crisp, bluesy guitar from Jerry and hot vocals from Bob.
Sadly the final version. Glad Bruce was along for it. Seamless CC rider > train
Nice how Jerry really cranks his lead up nice n loud after bobby plays some slide

performances.venue: Downs of Santa Fe Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: Nice pacing with good energy.  Playing is good with exception of Bobby's slide solo, which falls into that period of out of tune passion.
breezy cortado with flair and ease in the jort shortz hoodoo daddy slot. Radiant accompanying by all
Searing!! down home 'n titeeee Beatz and cruisin altitude for pure chonky blues goods
Not the perfect audio, but sleazy and breezy. Solid early 80s CC
Farm Aid '86 ish

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: Bobby howls and Brent takes them to church and oh yeah Jerry plays some sweet licks
Laid back and struttin', Brent's organ and Bobby's rhythm/slide make this a worthwhile listen.

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: One of the best!
See what you done done
nice blues number from a good run of shows
Absolutely chaotic. Brent and Bobby were going nuts and so was the crowd.
